intro: Ranunculus trigonocarpus, commonly known as the three-lobed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to seven petals and a hairy, yellow center. The plant has palmately divided leaves that are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Ranunculaceae family.
